intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius stenolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, while its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium stenolepis is an herbaceous perennial that spreads through rhizomes and is often found in disturbed habitats.
